title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang addresses rising competition at shareholder meeting after historic stock surge
content: Since last year's meeting, Nvidia has been on a historic run.
summary: Since last year's meeting, Nvidia has been on a historic run.

title: Asia-Pacific markets fall after Japan's yen weakens to a near 38-year low; Hong Kong leads losses
content: The Japanese yen weakened to a near 38-year low late Wednesday, dropping to 160.82 against the U.S. dollar, according to FactSet data.
summary: The Japanese yen weakened to a near 38-year low late Wednesday, dropping to 160.82 against the U.S. dollar, according to FactSet data.

title: In a new round of 'panda diplomacy,' China sends giant bears to the U.S. after two decades
content: After 21 years, giant pandas are en route from China to the U.S. — a sign that Beijing is resuming its "panda diplomacy" efforts as relations with the West thaw.
summary: After 21 years, giant pandas are en route from China to the U.S. — a sign that Beijing is resuming its "panda diplomacy" efforts as relations with the West thaw.

title: Amazon plans to launch discount store in bid to fend off Temu and Shein
content: Amazon's storefront would directly compete with Temu and Shein, two emerging e-commerce sites with ties to China that have grown in popularity in the U.S.
summary: Amazon's storefront would directly compete with Temu and Shein, two emerging e-commerce sites with ties to China that have grown in popularity in the U.S.

title: India's water crisis could lead to unrest, hurt economic growth, Moody's warns
content: Severe water shortages in India could hurt its sovereign credit strength, according to Moody's Ratings.
summary: Severe water shortages in India could hurt its sovereign credit strength, according to Moody's Ratings.

title: Japanese yen hits weakest level against dollar since 1986, reigniting intervention speculation
content: The yen weakened to 160.82 against the greenback according to FactSet data, breaching the previous record of 160.03 on April 29.
summary: The yen weakened to 160.82 against the greenback according to FactSet data, breaching the previous record of 160.03 on April 29.

title: Forget to-do lists. Here are 4 tips on how to stop procrastinating
content: In a world that is increasingly distractible, learning how to harness our attention is the "skill of the century," says best-selling author Nir Eyal.
summary: In a world that is increasingly distractible, learning how to harness our attention is the "skill of the century," says best-selling author Nir Eyal.

title: Onboard forests, street markets and reefs: Disney releases details about its new cruise in Singapore
content: The Disney Adventure will sail three- and four-night voyages from Singapore starting in 2025, with the capacity to carry some 6,700 passengers on board.
summary: The Disney Adventure will sail three- and four-night voyages from Singapore starting in 2025, with the capacity to carry some 6,700 passengers on board.

title: China's EV architect says investing in Europe is a way forward
content: Wan Gang became China's minister of Science and Technology around 2010 and is known for spearheading the country's early push into electric cars.
summary: Wan Gang became China's minister of Science and Technology around 2010 and is known for spearheading the country's early push into electric cars.

title: This Southeast Asian city is the world's most expensive for the super rich — Hong Kong comes second
content: The price of owning a car in Singapore — the most expensive globally at 2.5 times the average — soared 15% from a year earlier in U.S. dollar terms.
summary: The price of owning a car in Singapore — the most expensive globally at 2.5 times the average — soared 15% from a year earlier in U.S. dollar terms.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Amazon enters $2 trillion club
content: The S&P 500 and Dow Jones closed slightly higher, while the Nasdaq Composite increased by 0.49%, with Nvidia recovering. Amazon hit a $2 trillion market cap.
summary: The S&P 500 and Dow Jones closed slightly higher, while the Nasdaq Composite increased by 0.49%, with Nvidia recovering. Amazon hit a $2 trillion market cap.

title: Federal Reserve says all 31 banks in annual stress test withstood a severe hypothetical downturn
content: This year's stress test included JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs, credit card companies including American Express and regional lenders such as Truist.
summary: This year's stress test included JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs, credit card companies including American Express and regional lenders such as Truist.

title: Amazon reaches $2 trillion market cap for the first time
content: The company joins other tech heavyweights, such as Nvidia, Apple, Alphabet and Microsoft, all of which have crossed a $2 trillion market capitalization.
summary: The company joins other tech heavyweights, such as Nvidia, Apple, Alphabet and Microsoft, all of which have crossed a $2 trillion market capitalization.

title: U.S. ambassador accuses China of undermining bilateral ties, Wall Street Journal reports
content: This comes after ties between the U.S. and China have somewhat warmed after Xi and Biden met in November.
summary: This comes after ties between the U.S. and China have somewhat warmed after Xi and Biden met in November.

title: Micron shares slide after revenue forecast fails to top estimates
content: Micron reported better-than-expected results on Wednesday, but the stock declined on a forecast that was only in line with estimates.
summary: Micron reported better-than-expected results on Wednesday, but the stock declined on a forecast that was only in line with estimates.

title: Trade feuds aside, Chinese firms are committed to the U.S. market, survey shows
content: A survey of Chinese enterprises in the U.S. has found that a majority remain bullish on the market long-term despite concerns about U.S.-China relations.
summary: A survey of Chinese enterprises in the U.S. has found that a majority remain bullish on the market long-term despite concerns about U.S.-China relations.

title: SpaceX is building a NASA craft to intentionally destroy the International Space Station after retiring
content: NASA will have a spacecraft from Elon Musk's SpaceX guide the International Space Station's destruction after its retirement.
summary: NASA will have a spacecraft from Elon Musk's SpaceX guide the International Space Station's destruction after its retirement.

title: Biden Cabinet officials roll out new plans to cut costs of living ahead of Trump debate
content: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and over a dozen other White House Cabinet members are making stops around the U.S. ahead of the Biden-Trump debate.
summary: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and over a dozen other White House Cabinet members are making stops around the U.S. ahead of the Biden-Trump debate.

title: Morgan Stanley wealth advisors are about to get an OpenAI-powered assistant to do their grunt work

title: Google is testing facial recognition technology for campus security, starting at site near Seattle

title: Levi's shares drop 12% as jeans maker's sales disappoint despite denim craze
content: Levi's has been working to build out its own website and stores, and while the strategy has lifted profits, sales aren't budging much.
summary: Levi's has been working to build out its own website and stores, and while the strategy has lifted profits, sales aren't budging much.

title: Rivian investment a ‘catch-up move’ for Volkswagen that could take years to pay off, advisory firm says
content: Volkswagen’s $5 billion investment in electrical vehicle startup Rivian is a “catch-up move” for the German automaker, Cyrus Mewawalla says.
summary: Volkswagen’s $5 billion investment in electrical vehicle startup Rivian is a “catch-up move” for the German automaker, Cyrus Mewawalla says.

title: Southwest Airlines cuts revenue forecast, blaming changing booking patterns
content: The company said it still expects record quarterly operating revenue in the second quarter.

title: YouTube dominates streaming, forcing media companies to decide whether it's friend or foe
content: YouTube is gaining share of viewership on TVs, and legacy media doesn't have a uniform strategy to deal with the threat.
summary: YouTube is gaining share of viewership on TVs, and legacy media doesn't have a uniform strategy to deal with the threat.

title: European stocks close lower as euro extends declines; tech firms nudge higher
content: European stocks closed lower Wednesday, extending negative sentiment seen in the previous trading session.

title: Delta's most exclusive airport lounge opens. Here's what's inside
content: The Delta One lounge is the airline's latest effort to reel in customers and offers perks like massages, showers and a high-end restaurant.
summary: The Delta One lounge is the airline's latest effort to reel in customers and offers perks like massages, showers and a high-end restaurant.

title: U.S. chip curbs in Middle East just 'business as usual,' Ooredoo CEO says after Nvidia deal
content: Ooredoo earlier this week signed a partnership with Nvidia, marking the chipmaker's first large-scale entry into the Middle East market. The companies did not disclose the value of the deal.
summary: Ooredoo earlier this week signed a partnership with Nvidia, marking the chipmaker's first large-scale entry into the Middle East market. The companies did not disclose the value of the deal.

title: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange lands in Australia after U.S. plea deal
content: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange returned to Australia on Thursday after pleading guilty in a U.S. court in the Northern Mariana Islands.
summary: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange returned to Australia on Thursday after pleading guilty in a U.S. court in the Northern Mariana Islands.

title: Europe is at risk of over-restricting AI and falling behind U.S. and China, Dutch prince says
content: Prince Constantijn of the Netherlands told CNBC Europe risks limiting its role in artificial intelligence to being a regulator, rather than an innovator.
summary: Prince Constantijn of the Netherlands told CNBC Europe risks limiting its role in artificial intelligence to being a regulator, rather than an innovator.

title: Oil prices move higher despite unexpected build in U.S. crude, gasoline stockpiles
content: Crude oil stockpiles rose by 3.6 million barrels last week, according to data released by the Energy Information Administration.
